entries.entry: Tommy did an amazing job explaining how to do the Daily Journal exercise
Tommy lectured about array methods: forEach, map, reduce, filter, and sort

entries.concept: Deleting entries from a JSON file
entries.entry: Jordan lectured on how to delete entries from a JSON file by adding a delete button to the object that are printed.  She used the restaurants api as an example.
Jordan lectured on editing an object in the DOM.  We learned how to inject a form in the DOM entry and autopopulate it with information from the JSON file.
Jordan gave the second lecture on CRUD: Update.  During the live-code event she showed us how to grab the information in the edit form and PUT it in the JSON file.
Jordan lectured on a few different database relationships, and using join tables in JSON files.
